title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum won't play against the 76ers as he continues recovery from a right Achilles injury.
Joel Embiid of the 76ers will miss the game against the Celtics due to an oblique strain.
Celtics have recently won eight of their last ten games, sitting second in the East standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins in a Grapefruit League game, continuing his strong spring training start.
Duran has struggled against left-handed pitchers in his career, but hit 409-foot homers against lefties on consecutive days.
Duran's performance raises questions about his role with the Red Sox, possibly fitting into the designated hitter or three-hole spot.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have combined for 39 goals this season with Boston College.
Hagens, a 2025 first-round draft pick, has scored 39 points in 29 games after shifting from center to wing.
Letourneau, drafted in 2024, emerged as a top player in Hockey East with 19 goals in 31 games this season.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach named the Boston Celtics the 'clear favorite' to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics rank second in offensive rating, with a league-leading 9.9 net rating since Thanksgiving, currently behind the Detroit Pistons.
Despite being 5.5 games behind, Boston's strong scoring and playmaking abilities put them ahead of the Pistons in net rating.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The concert featured a mix of Americana, Southern rock, country, and folk, with songs like 'It Gets Easier' and 'Elephant'.
Isbell's setlist included solo tracks, Drive-By Truckers covers, and The Rolling Stones' 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking'.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots may not acquire top edge rushers like Maxx Crosby, Trey Hendrickson, or Jaelan Phillips this offseason.
Las Vegas Raiders may keep Maxx Crosby; Patriots are reportedly priced out of Trey Hendrickson and Jaelan Phillips.
New England might focus on drafting an edge rusher like Missouri's Zion Young with their 31st pick.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance is set to acquire Warner Brothers Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
The deal may integrate CBS and TNT/TBS, enhancing sports coverage such as MLB, NHL, and college football.
Netflix may reconsider its sports rights strategy after withdrawing from the Warner Brothers Discovery bidding war.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are interested in acquiring A.J. Brown but find the Eagles' current asking price too high.
If traded before June 1, the Eagles would incur $44 million in dead money with a $20 million cap space loss.
A trade package for Brown may surpass what the Steelers gave for D.K. Metcalf, involving high draft picks.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts E-ZPass is transitioning from hard-plastic transponders to RFID windshield sticker tags starting Sunday.
The new sticker tags will be free for E-ZPass customers and cost only 55 cents to produce.
MassDOT expects annual savings of $7.4 million from the switch due to lower production costs.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito of Woburn charged with 10 tax offenses, including evasion and filing false returns, totaling $1.2 million evaded.
Brito allegedly underreported $20 million in business income from his Medford-based company, Boston Quality Cleaning Services.
State Police and FBI executed searches, recovering $35,000 and documents as part of the investigation.
